definition: to change shifts/to work in turns
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: Adapt to shift work and can work under big pressure.
sentences.chinese: 适应倒班工作，能够承受一定的工作压力。

sentences.english: The medicine is already approved to fight narcolepsy and sleepiness related to shift work.
sentences.chinese: 此药已经获准用于治疗因倒班产生的嗜睡和瞌睡症状。

sentences.english: The World Health Organization has classified shift work as a probable carcinogen.
sentences.chinese: 世界卫生组织把倒班的工作列为致癌的行为。

sentences.english: Hurricane season puts the crew on multiple shifts.
sentences.chinese: 飓风季节里，机组成员常常要倒班连续工作。

sentences.english: Dai and his colleagues work in shifts round the clock.
sentences.chinese: 戴邵帅和同事们每天24小时倒班工作。

definition: to shift holidays, taking a weekday off
to change shift/the next work shift/to relieve (a workman on the previous shift)/to take over the job
to act as substitute/to fill in for sb
time of going to work/the morning rush hour

pinyin: ba1 xiao3 shi2 gong1 zuo4 zhi4

definition: lit. to continuously revolve/to work non-stop/to work around the clock (idiom)
